Wyodrebnione_rozpoznania_pooperacyjne: ENDOMETRIOSIS OF THE LEFT PERIANAL FOSSA, CERVICAL ENDOMETRIOSIS, LEFT SACRO-UTERINE LIGAMENT ENDOMETRIOSIS, ENDOMETRIOSIS OF THE RIGHT OVARIAN FOSSA, SIGMOID ADHESION, PELVIC CONGESTION SYNDROME, ENDOMETRIAL TUMOR OF THE RECTUS ABDOMINIS, PERITONEAL ENDOMETRIAL TUMOR, RECTOVAGINAL ENDOMETRIOSIS
Tlumaczenie_Ang_Rozpoznanie_pooperacyjne: ENDOMETRIOSIS OF THE LEFT PERIANAL FOSSA. CERVICAL ENDOMETRIOSIS AND LEFT SACRO-UTERINE LIGAMENT ENDOMETRIOSIS. ENDOMETRIOSIS OF THE RIGHT OVARIAN FOSSA. SIGMOID ADHESION. PELVIC CONGESTION SYNDROME. ENDOMETRIAL TUMOR OF THE RECTUS ABDOMINIS. PERITONEAL ENDOMETRIAL TUMOR. RECTOVAGINAL ENDOMETRIOSIS.
Wyodrebnione_zakres_operacji: Adhesions in the subcutaneous tissue were dissected, 2 cm mass was found and separated from the bladder, adhesions of the sigmoid colon to the left pelvic wall were released, endometrial infiltrative foci in the right ovarian fossa were removed, extraperitoneal space on the left side was dissected, endometrial infiltration of the left perirectal space, left sacrouterine ligament, and left perirectal space was excised, ovarian veins were selectively closed bilaterally, thorough inspection of the intestine was performed, hemostasis control and thorough irrigation of the peritoneal cavity, HyaRegen Gel was left in the peritoneal cavity.
Tlumaczenie_Ang_Zakres_operacji: Numerous adhesions in the subcutaneous tissue were dissected, and a 2 cm mass was found located paravesically medially in both bellies of the rectus abdominis muscle. Additionally, there was an infiltrative focus in the peritoneum on the left side beneath the left rectus muscles. The nodular foci are likely indicative of endometriosis. The peritoneal cavity was opened by separating the bladder from the mass. In the lesser pelvis, endometrial changes were noted in the area of the rectovaginal septum, primarily on the left side. Adhesions of the sigmoid colon to the left pelvic wall were released. Subsequently, endometrial infiltrative foci in the right ovarian fossa were removed. The extraperitoneal space on the left side was then dissected, and the endometrial infiltration of the left perirectal space, left sacrouterine ligament, and left perirectal space was excised, preserving a margin of healthy tissue and restoring the normal anatomy of the pelvic organs. The ovarian veins were selectively closed bilaterally. A thorough inspection of the intestine was performed, and no endometrial infiltrates were found within the intestine. After hemostasis control and thorough irrigation of the peritoneal cavity, HyaRegen Gel was left in the peritoneal cavity as a preventive measure against adhesions.

Wyodrebnione_rozpoznania_pooperacyjne: Adenomyosis, Endometriosis involving the right round ligament, Superficial endometriosis on the right ovary, Endometriotic cyst on the left ovary, Extensive deeply infiltrating endometriosis in the left sacrouterine ligament, Extensive endometrial infiltration of the sigmoid-rectal flexure
Tlumaczenie_Ang_Rozpoznanie_pooperacyjne: Findings: The uterus is slightly enlarged with a doughy consistency corresponding to adenomyosis, with limited mobility. There is a bladder-uterine fold with a solid focus of endometriosis, involving the right round ligament. The right fallopian tube has a free course, and the right ovary has a superficial focus of endometriosis. The left fallopian tube is in massive adhesions with the ovary (with a 2.5 cm endometriotic cyst) and with the sigmoid-rectal flexure, all embedded in the left iliac fossa. In the area of the left sacrouterine ligament, there is an extensive focus of deeply infiltrating endometriosis. The sigmoid colon is adherent to the lateral wall of the abdominal cavity and pelvis. Outside the pelvis, the peritoneum is smooth, the liver has a smooth surface, and the appendix and other abdominal organs show no significant changes. The sigmoid-rectal flexure has extensive endometrial infiltration limiting the lumen of the rectum by approximately 60%.
Wyodrebnione_zakres_operacji: Laparoscopy, Release of adhesions, Excision of the left ovarian endometrioma, Resection of endometriosis foci in the lesser pelvis, Chromopertubation, Segmental resection of the sigmoid-rectal junction with end-to-side anastomosis, Adhesion prevention with HyaRegen gel, Laparoscopy, Hemostasis, Extensive irrigation of the abdominal cavity, Use of Arista AH, Suturing of anastomosis leak with single stitches, Aspiration of fibrin collections and clots, Laparotomy, Removal of 1-1.5 liters of blood and clots, Argon beam coagulation of bleeding sites, Coverage with Tachosil, Extensive irrigation.
Tlumaczenie_Ang_Zakres_operacji:
Main operation:  
Laparoscopy. Release of adhesions. Excision of the left ovarian endometrioma. Resection of endometriosis foci in the lesser pelvis. Chromopertubation. Segmental resection of the sigmoid-rectal junction with end-to-side anastomosis. Adhesion prevention - HyaRegen gel.

Reoperation on the same day due to bleeding: laparoscopy, hemostasis, extensive irrigation of the abdominal cavity, Arista AH.

Operation one week later, caused by peritonitis: cloudy fluid was identified, but no intestinal contents were found. A leak was visualized on the anterior wall of the anastomosis, approximately 1 cm in diameter. It was sutured with single stitches, and fibrin collections and small amounts of clots were aspirated from the pelvis.

Operation one week later, due to sudden bleeding into the peritoneum (likely caused by the onset of menstruation and heparin associated with renal replacement therapy): laparotomy (nothing was visible in laparoscopy and there was no progress in suctioning). Removal of 1-1.5 liters of blood along with clots. Bleeding sites on the left and anterior wall of the pelvic canal, treated with argon beam coagulation, covered with Tachosil. Extensive irrigation.

Wyodrebnione_dodatkowe_metody: SSRIs, consultation with psychiatrists, walking, napping, relaxation with ASMR, medical marijuana, partially following dietitian recommendations, advice from Tim Spector, advice from Will Bulsiewicz, advice from Peter Attia
Tlumaczenie_Ang_Jakie_inne_metody:
I used SSRIs for a year due to adjustment disorders related to complications after surgery and hospitalization, and I have just discontinued them. I consulted with psychiatrists regarding medication therapy, but I did not engage in psychotherapy as I did not feel the need. I try to reduce stress through walking, napping, and relaxation with ASMR. I use medical marijuana—theoretically for pain, but I do not actually experience it, so sometimes I use it for relaxation.

Regarding the question about a dietitian—I partially followed her recommendations, but I omitted what I considered nonsensical and added what I found valuable based on my own knowledge (guided by the advice of Tim Spector, Will Bulsiewicz, and Peter Attia, which generally have a positive impact on health). I have the impression that dietary counseling regarding endometriosis is excessively dominated by the buzzword "anti-inflammatory/pro-inflammatory." This is extremely reductive and moderately verifiable, leading women down the path of overly restrictive diets, which impoverishes the microbiome and distracts them from more important issues than "turkey or chicken," such as "alcohol—yes or no," "diversity of fiber in the diet," "adequate protein intake," etc.

Tlumaczenie_Ang_Jakie_inne_metody: I have a profession in social rehabilitation, so I am professionally prepared for self-care and basic physiotherapy. I have developed an individual set of physiotherapy exercises and activities based on my symptoms. Due to IBS, I avoid irritating my intestines, which is why I follow a low FODMAP and low-fat diet. I avoid allergens because I also have several allergies. I avoid sitting for more than 1 hour at a time or 5 hours a day, as this triggers pain and intestinal obstructions due to adhesions. I also avoid intense physical activity for the same reason.
